meanings.definition: Able to be sold or marketed.
meanings.sent1: The new product is very marketable due to its low price.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent knew the house would be marketable because of its prime location.
meanings.sent3: The idea of selling ice to penguins is not very marketable.
meanings.sent4: Her skills in negotiation make her a highly marketable candidate for the job.
meanings.sent5: The shiny packaging made the product incredibly marketable to consumers.

meanings.definition: Attractive or desirable to potential buyers.
meanings.sent1: The colorful artwork on the walls made the room more marketable.
meanings.sent2: The vintage car was very marketable to collectors.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a pet rock may not seem marketable, but it was a huge hit in the 70s.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious smile made her marketable in the entertainment industry.
meanings.sent5: The unique design of the handbag made it highly marketable among fashion enthusiasts.

meanings.definition: Suitable for sale in a market.
meanings.sent1: The fresh produce was very marketable at the farmer's market.
meanings.sent2: The handmade crafts were highly marketable at the local fair.
meanings.sent3: Selling snow to Eskimos would not be a very marketable business plan.
meanings.sent4: His artistic talent made his paintings marketable in the art gallery.
meanings.sent5: The quality of the fabric made the clothing line extremely marketable to customers.
